pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:4.1: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:5.1: 8. The second training rule on lowered eyes
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were sitting in inhabited areas, looking here and there. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:7.2: “‘I will sit with lowered eyes in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:8.1: Sitting in an inhabited area, one should lower one’s eyes, looking the distance of a plows-length ahead.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, sits in an inhabited area, looking here and there, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:9.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk8:10.1: The eighth training rule is finished.
